newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan students burn vehicles in police clashes.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan students burn vehicles in police clashes.

text.p: Pakistani Islamist students fought police with stones and set alight at least eight vehicles during a demonstration on Tuesday in the Punjab provincial capital of Lahore, witnesses said.
Police said they fired teargas and arrested about 70 members of the Islami Jamiat-i-Talaba group, the student arm of the opposition fundamentalist Jamaat-i-Islami party, for rioting.

The clashes occurred after the police fired teargas to stop thousands of students from marching on the official home of provincial Chief Minister Mohammad Arif Nakai to press several demands, including denationalisation of educational institutions and revival of banned student unions, the witnesses said.
